result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory A Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes:
Court allows for transfer of probation to Minnesota.
Court sets a review dat to determine if an agent has been assigned and has addressed housing and educational issues.  Hearing March 29, 2016 at 8:30 in BR. 21.

miscConds.notes:
Pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments, DNA surcharge.   To be collected during term of probation.
If revoked, all related surcharges  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time defendant to have a part time job.  Obtain GED or HSED.  Vocational assessment.  Participate in any programs recommended.

Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Mental health assessment. Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with Kenneth W.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes: Day Reporting Center release for educational and treatment.  No good time crdit.  No electronic monitoring.

charges.descr: Attempt Robbery with Use of Force

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory A Thomas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Gregory A Thomas not in court, in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discussion with the parties as to whether it is appropriate for the court to address issues with probation.
Court takes no action at this time.  No further court date scheduled.
Clerk:  jms

COURT ENTRY MADE WITHOUT CASE FILE IN COURT:
Court will not be in session on March 29.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on February 25 to re-scheduled probation hearing.
Clerk:  jms
Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.

JOC not showing HOC condition time.
TO CORRECT to show the five (5) months condition time as ordered at sentencing.
records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gregory A Thomas in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Gregory A Thomas in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 1/2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 192  DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 
-Restitution set at $0 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended 
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician
-No contact with Kenneth W.
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Defendant to perform 40 hours of community service
-Court allows for transfer of Probation to Minnesota
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with Day Reporting Center release for educational and treatment.  No good time credit.  No electronic monitoring.   

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Court sets a Review Date to determine if an agent has been assigned and has addressed housing and educational issues.

Defendant Gregory A Thomas in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Gregory A Thomas in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Parties requests a Presentence Investigation Report.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Gregory A Thomas not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter rescheduled for plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gregory A Thomas in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment of the currently scheduled plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 21.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, Defendant Gregory A Thomas not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for Megan Patricia Carmody for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Gregory A Thomas not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant motion for modification of bail heard and granted.  Court modifies bail to $2,500.00 cash with the same conditions.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 06-16-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gregory A Thomas in court with Attorney Calvin Malone, appearing for Attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Gregory A Thomas in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  
Defense counsel requests adjournment for bail hearing on the next court date.
Court ordered case adjourned for bail hearing and scheduling conference in Branch 21.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Kenneth W.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gregory A Thomas in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Gregory A Thomas in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he  may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4). 

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
